article:
'Interconnectivity' is a concept that is used in numerous fields such as
cybernetics, biology, ecology, network theory, and non-linear dynamics. The
concept can be summarized as that all parts of a system interact with and rely
on one another simply by the fact that they occupy the same system, and that a
system is difficult or sometimes impossible to analyze through its individual
parts considered alone. The concept is closely linked to the observer effect and
the butterfly effect. It is often linked to the concepts
of interconnectedness which is used to refer to the spiritual, and
interdependence which refers to the moral, rather than physical or scientific.
